content.description:
This is the line up the middle of the face.

Start on the low obvious slopey edge. Work your feet up to reach some good edges and left-facing gastons. The crux comes when delicately moving feet up to allow for a reach to the small crimp just over the lip of the boulder. The topout is slopey and is no gimme either.

Overall, this is a very delicate boulder that always keeps you on your toes (pun intended)!

Please let me know if you have any further info on this route.
content.protection: There is a good landing, and use pads.

content.description:
Start as for

Microchips

. Work your way up and left to reach several good, left facing sidepulls. Work up your feet using the sidepulls and a high arete pinch to reach a delicate, slopey topout.

Again, if any history or FA is known, please let me know.
content.location:
This is just left of

Microchips

on the north face.
